DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to analyze the effect of a brief psychological intervention supported by Information and Communication Technologies, on the subjective well-being of hospitalized cancer patients. Participants are randomly assigned to one of 2 conditions: Intervention condition (4 Virtual reality sessions) and Control condition (waiting list control group).
DOC.brief_title: Promotion of Emotional Well-being in Hospitalized Cancer Patients by Virtual Reality
DOC.criteria: adults with any cancer diagnosis hospitalized for at least 1 week Karnofsky functional state ≥50 life expectancy ≥2 months serious psychopathology cognitive impairment
